title: Crash ends Mark Cavendish's hopes of winning record 35th Tour de France stage
description: Mark Cavendish has crashed at the Tour de France, forcing him to abandon the race and with it his hopes of winning a record-breaking 35th stage.

title: European Union's first openly gay head of state sworn in
description: The European Union's first openly gay head of state has been sworn in in Latvia.

title: Former Man Utd star Edwin van der Sar remains in intensive care with condition 'still concerning'
description: Former Manchester United and Netherlands goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar remains in a "stable but still concerning" condition after suffering bleeding around his brain.

title: UK 'discourages' use of cluster bombs, PM says after Biden agrees to send them to Ukraine
description: Rishi Sunak has said the UK "discourages" the use of cluster bombs after the US agreed to send them to Ukraine.

title: 'Everything is mined': Ukraine's front line medics reveal toll of gruelling counteroffensive
description: In the woods, hidden from enemy drones, ambulances wait. Just the sound of birds and the distant rumble of artillery. Medics sit killing time. But never for long, as the casualties start coming.

title: China's Xi calls for 'enhanced war planning' as jets sent near Taiwan
description: China has sent warships and fighter planes close to Taiwan during a visit by US treasury secretary Janet Yellen to Beijing aimed at easing strained relations.

title: Paris Hilton accused of 'problematic puppy purchase'
description: Paris Hilton has been criticised by animal rights group PETA for buying a new chihuahua puppy - which is related to her beloved dog who died earlier this year.

title: Vladimir Putin plans rare overseas trip to visit NATO member Turkey
description: Vladimir Putin is planning a rare overseas trip to Turkey next month, the country's president Recep Tayyip Erdogan has revealed.
